text: hey guys it's Alisa welcome back to
another delicious episode of my cupcake
addiction today I'm going to be showing
you how to make s'mores pie now this is
partly because s'mores are amazing and I
think they deserve to be in pie form but
also because as an Australian we don't
do s'mores mainly because we don't have
access to graham crackers here so this
is for all you ideas that have been
wanting to know what s'mores tastes like
and for everybody else that just loves
them and wants to see them in pie form
the things that you're gonna need for
your delicious s'mores pie I've got some
milk chocolate I've also got some really
finely crushed cookies now if you're in
the u.s. you use graham crackers but
because I'm in Australia I'm using milk
arrowroot cookies anywhere else you just
want to use any sort of a plain white
biscuit and you want to crush it really
nice and fine I've got a half a cup of
castor sugar I've got some melted butter
and I've also got a ton of white
marshmallows I'm going to leave all of
your quantities and conversions on the
my cupcake addiction comm website so you
can check out that recipe and print it
out there I'm going to use a tart pan
today so I've got the one with the nice
fluted edge you can also use something
like a springform pan you could use a
dish you can use pretty much anything
you want so let's get started first off
we're gonna make our base so for the
base you just get to stir that sugar
through my graham cracker crumbs or my
milk arrowroot crumbs just to sweeten
things up a little bit and once they're
all nicely combined and I can't see any
more white from the sugar I'm gonna add
in my melted butter stirring it all
through until it's really well combined
depending on the type of biscuits that
you've gone with they may be slightly
more absorbent or less absorbent than
the ones that I'm using today so you can
add a little more butter or a little
less so you'll know they're done when
you squeeze them together and they hold
their shape curve a little bit like wet
sand I'm gonna scoop that into my pie
dish or my tart shell and I've got one
of the ones with the removable bases so
I'm not going to worry about greasing it
or anything I'm going to push that down
up around the edges and make sure that
it's nice and compacted but make sure
it's nice and high so it's coming all
the way the outside edges and up to the
tops of your shell you can use something
with just a flat base just to help to
compress it down and it kind of pushes
it and forces it up those edges as well
a really neat trick here to get those
nights flat top edges it's just to take
a knife and just run it along I'm going
to push it straight back into the crust
and then I'll Pat it down again but
that'll give me a nice sort of a flat
top on my fluted edge
that's my base it's really easy to make
it's beautiful and compact I'm going to
pop it off into the oven now for about
15 minutes because I know that I've got
one of those loose bottom tins going on
here I've been very careful to only
handle my tray on the outside edges so
don't accidentally pop the base up and
ruin my beautiful crust now while that's
still hot or you can wait for it to cool
it really doesn't matter I'm going to
hover the base and some of the sides in
my milk chocolate now I'm going to take
my marshmallows and I'm just going to
lay the top relatively neatly until I've
completely covered my pie in marshmallow
I've still got a few leftover
marshmallows so I'm just gonna go and
squish them into any little nooks and
crannies that I might be able to see cuz
you can never ever have too much
marshmallow in s'mores if you're going
to be serving this at a dinner party or
serving it to friends you can leave it
like that until just before you're ready
to serve a s'mores pie is best served
hot cuz all of that chocolates gonna be
melted your marshmallow is gonna be warm
and freshly gooey I'm gonna put mine
back in the oven now it's gonna go in
for about another 5 or 10 minutes and
you want to watch it as soon as those
marshmallows start to brown relatively
evenly you want to get it out of the
oven
I wouldn't recommend leaving this foot
too long because you definitely don't
want burnt marshmallows on your s'mores
pie our s'mores pie is completely done
and it looks amazing
that's only taken about 15 minutes in my
oven but your oven times are gonna vary
so what you're really looking for here
is that beautiful even browning of the
marshmallows so I'm just gonna gently
ease it out of that container and you
can see on the edges some of my
marshmallow is sticking a little bit so
do be quite gentle slide it down with my
arm protected by my yellow cloth onto
that little base and I'm gonna leave the
metal base on the bottom of my s'mores
pie it's gonna give it extra support cuz
that cookie graham cracker all milk
arrowroot crust is still gonna be a
little bit flexible while it's really
hot when you slice into your s'mores pie
you've got your crunchy graham cracker
base you've got your beautiful milk
chocolate and you've got that gorgeous
melted smooth marshmallow with a little
bit of crunch on top I hope you guys
have enjoyed my take on the classic us
s'mores dish for the Australians and for
any of you guys out there that have
never experienced s'mores I highly
recommend you get on the
bandwagon it's amazing if you're not
already subscribed to the channel make
sure you do for two new videos every
week and as always guys thanks very much
for watching
you
